result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:26 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kenneth Robert Sobbe in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Kenneth Robert Sobbe. Proof of service for Protective Order
Protective Order
Hearing on April 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim *A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.
The original document name was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 04-25-2022

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 2 miles of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.   Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.
